casebody.data:
STATE EX REL. UTILITIES COMMISSION
v.
ATTORNEY GENERAL 401A18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. May 7, 2019 Jennifer T. Harrod, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, Teresa L. Townsend, Assistant Attorney General, Margaret A. Force, Assistant Attorney General, James W. Doggett, Deputy Solicitor General, Matt Burke, Solicitor General Fellow, for Stein, Josh (Attorney General). Kiran H. Mehta, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Molly McIntosh Jagannathan, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC. Matthew D. Quinn, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Bridget M. Lee, Attorney at Law, Dorothy E. Jaffe, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, Pro Hac Vice, for Sierra Club. Peter H. Ledford, Attorney at Law, Benjamin Smith, Regulatory Counsel, for N.C. Sustainable Energy Association. Gudrun Thompson, Attorney at Law, David L. Neal, Attorney at Law, for N.C. Justice Center, et al. David T. Drooz, Chief Counsel, Lucy E. Edmondson, Staff Attorney, Chris Ayers, Staff Attorney, Layla Cummings, Staff Attorney, Megan Jost, Staff Attorney, Nadia Luhr, Staff Attorney, for N.C. Utilities Commission-Public Staff.

From N.C. Utilities Commission (E-7,SUB1110 E-7,SUB1146); From Wake (E-7, Sub 1110)

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 7th of May 2019 by Attorney General to Amend Appendix to Brief:

*692"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 7th of May 2019."
